entry.title: The Coroners and Justice Act 2009 (Commencement No. 1 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 14th December 2009 the provisions of the Coroners and Justice Act 2009 set out in article 2. Those provisions amend sections 57B, 57D and 57E of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998, which relate to “live links”. A live link is a video-link between a court and either a police station or a place where a person is being held in custody. The amendments enable directions in relation to live links to be made by a single justice as well as a full bench, remove the need for the accused to consent to the making of a direction, and ensure that a direction may not be made unless the court is satisfied that it is not contrary to the interests of justice to do so. The amendments to section 57B and 57E do not apply to a live link direction given before 14th December 2009 (article 4(1)).

entry.title: The Corporation Tax (Financing Costs and Income) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations make provisions relating to the treatment for the purposes of corporation tax of certain financing costs and financing expenses of companies that are members of a group. The regulations are supplemental to the provisions made by Schedule 15 to the Finance Act 2009 (“Schedule 15”).

title.div: The Learning and Skills (Wales) Measure 2009 (Commencement No. 1 and Transitional Provision) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn Mesur Dysgu a Sgiliau (Cymru) 2009 (Cychwyn Rhif 1 a Darpariaeth Drosiannol) 2009

div.p: This is the first Commencement Order made by the Welsh Ministers under the Learning and Skills (Wales) Measure 2009. It brings into force on 7 December 2009 and 1 January 2010 various provisions of the Measure specified in article 2 of the Order.

Hwn yw'r Gorchymyn Cychwyn cyntaf a wnaed gan Weinidogion Cymru o dan Fesur Dysgu a Sgiliau (Cymru) 2009. Mae'n dod ag amryfal ddarpariaethau'r Mesur a bennir yn erthygl 2 o'r Gorchymyn i rym ar 7 Rhagfyr 2009 ac 1 Ionawr 2010.

entry.title: The Education (School Teachers’ Qualifications) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (School Teachers’ Qualifications) (England) Regulations 2003.

entry.title: The Customs (Contravention of a Relevant Rule) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend regulation 2 and the Schedule to the Customs (Contravention of a Relevant Rule) Regulations 2003 (“the 2003 Regulations”). Where a person of a prescribed description contravenes one of the relevant rules listed in the Schedule he is liable to a penalty of the prescribed amount.

entry.title: The Sheep and Goats (Records, Identification and Movement) (England) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for the administration and enforcement in England of Council Regulation (EC) No. 21/2004 (establishing a system for the identification and registration of ovine and caprine animals and amending Regulation (EC) No. 1782/2003 and Directives 92/102/EEC and 64/432/EEC). It revokes and replaces the Sheep and Goats (Records, Identification and Movement) (England) Order 2007, S.I. 2007/3493.

entry.title: The Nitrate Pollution Prevention (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Nitrate Pollution Prevention Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008/2349) (“the Nitrate Regulations”) and the Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 1994 (S.I. 1994/2716) (“the Habitats Regulations”).

entry.title: The Carbon Accounting (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend an error in regulation 6 of the Carbon Accounting Regulations 2009. They adjust the annual amount of carbon units to be used in determining the amount of units to be credited to or debited from the net UK carbon account as a result of the operation of the European Union Emissions Trading Scheme. This ensures that the annual amounts add up to the UK allocation under the European Union Emissions Trading Scheme for the period 2008-2012.

entry.title: The Price Marking (Amendment) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Price Marking Order 2004 (SI 2004/102). Article 11 of that Order allowed traders to indicate changes to the Value Added Tax rate on goods by way of a general notice, for a period of up to 14 days after the change had come into effect. This Order extends that period to 28 days.

entry.title: The Offshore Funds (Tax) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Offshore Funds (Tax) Regulations 2009 which make provision for the tax treatment of participants in offshore funds. These Regulations have effect from the same days as the Offshore Funds (Tax) Regulations 2009 have effect. Authority for this limited retrospective effect is provided by section 42(5) of the Finance Act 2009.

entry.title: The INSPIRE Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Directive 2007/2/EC (OJ No L 108, 25.4.2007, p. 1) (“the Directive”) which concerns the creation and operation of national and European Union infrastructures relating to spatial information for the purposes of EU environmental policies and other policies or activities which may have an impact on the environment.

entry.title: The Criminal Proceedings etc. (Reform) (Scotland) Act 2007 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2009
entry.summary: The Criminal Proceedingsetc. (Reform) (Scotland) Act 2007 (“the2007 Act”) received Royal Assent on 22ndFebruary 2007.

entry.title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Miscellaneous) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to England and Wales, amend four statutory instruments namely:

entry.title: The Licensing Act 2003 (Premises licences and club premises certificates) (Amendment) (Electronic Applications etc) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Licensing Act 2003 (Premises licences and club premises certificates) Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/42) (“the 2005 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Parliamentary Pensions (Amendment) (No 2) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Parliamentary Pensions (Consolidation and Amendment) Regulations 1993 (S.I. 1993/3253), which were made under the Parliamentary and other Pensions Act 1987 (c.45) (“the 1987 Act”) and set out a pension scheme for Members of Parliament, Ministers and holders of certain offices.

entry.title: The European Union (Amendment) Act 2008 (Commencement No.1) Order 2009
entry.summary: Article 2 of this order brings into force, on 1 December 2009, Section 3 of, and the Schedule to, the European Union (Amendment) Act 2008, which relate to changes of terminology. The effect of this is to update references to European Union terminology in other legislation to reflect changes made by the Treaty of Lisbon amending the Treaty Establishing the European Union and the Treaty Establishing the European Community. This order brings into force the changes of terminology provided by section 3 and the Schedule to the European Union (Amendment) Act 2008, including removing references to the Community Treaties and substituting the EU Treaties.

entry.title: The Child Support (Management of Payments and Arrears) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under powers in the Child Support Act 1991 (c.19) (“the 1991 Act”) and come into force on 25th January 2010. They are, in part, consolidating regulations which revoke and re-enact some provisions of the Child Support (Arrears, Interest and Adjustment of Maintenance Assessments) Regulations 1992 (S.I. 1992/1816) (“the AIMA Regulations”), with some changes.

entry.title: The Bolton Metropolitan Borough Council (School Meals) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order enables the Bolton Metropolitan Borough Council to charge different prices for school meals in primary schools which it maintains. It also enables the governing bodies of the named schools in Bolton to charge different prices for school meals. These schools are included in the Order because they have a delegated budget for school meals.

entry.title: The Value Added Tax (Supplementary Charge) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order which comes into force on 31st December 2009 provides for an exception to the categories of supply in relation to which a supplementary charge is due under Schedule 3 to the Finance Act 2009.

entry.title: The Thurrock and Basildon College (Dissolution) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order dissolves with effect from 1st January 2010 the further education corporation established to conduct Thurrock and Basildon College. It provides for the transfer of its property, rights and liabilities to The South East Essex College of Arts and Technology, Southend-on-Sea and secures the rights of its employees by applying section 26(2) to (4) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992.
